column4: I know this isn't even remote the right place for this... but... anyone know if there's any way to `svn export` but only the changed files?
svn up
er, export as in
commit your changes to the server or update your sandbox from the server?
I'm in a slightly odd situation, using mosso for hosting, so I have SSH access.  Right now, I'm using lftp to mirror the contents of an svn export from my dev server
oh... as in an actual export
i think you should forget about lftp and get rsync. or maybe even sshfs or nfs
rsync doesn't support ftp, does it?
nope
but ftp isn't really the solution for keeping things synced like you want
Unfortunately then, I'm stuck...  Mosso doesn't have anything but ftp right now.
if you have ssh, you most likely have sftp too. you can still use sshfs
That's what I mean, I don't have ssh at all.  I have only plain old ftp.
huh?
2:44:28 derekmounce> raylu: I'm in a slightly odd situation, using mosso for hosting, so I have SSH access.
whooooooops.  typo. ;) "don't" have ssh
oh.
why do you have it set up this way anyway? can't you just use mosso as the svn server?
mosso doesn't currently have subversion support, or root access
oh. i suppose they don't have dav_svn installed either...
in that case, why are you using svn?
naw, not just yet
Using svn because my codebase is 20k. ;)  Plus, I've been running the beta of my web app on a custom VPS.  But mosso scales like the amazon services, which is why I'm doing final hosting on them.
